page.title: 12Seed Potato Export _ Mulben
page.content: When I was visiting a Farm at Mulben I saw a field of patatoes,and I asked the farmer about them. He told us that when they are harvested in Autumn, they are not sold to be eaten, but are exported as {seed potatoes They are grown to be exported to hot countries as seed for their potato crop.The seed potatoes are sent to Portugal, Cuba, Ceylon, Israel, Morocco, Algeria and Italy. The seed potatoes are packed like apples in boxes for export. They are taken from Keith, by train, to Leith, and from Leith to their destination by ship. Seed potatoes from the North of Scotland grow very well in hot countries. The seed potatoes are a Dutch variety. They are inspected by the Dept. of Agriculture before planting and when they are growing.
